arm_group.description: Escalating single dose as subcutaneous injection

brief_summary.textblock:
BI 655064 will be administered subcutaneously once weekly in patients with immune
      thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP) for up to 12 weeks.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Rising Does Study (Subcutaneous Doses) of BI 655064 in Male and Female Patients With Chronic Primary Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

        Male and female chronic immune ITP patients

        Exclusion criteria:

        Any treatment of ITP excluded except for a stable dose of corticosteroids (up to 20 mg)

clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Efficacy, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Open Label Study With Multiple (and for Non Responders) Escalating Subcutaneous Doses of BI 655064 Once a Week in Patients With Chronic Primary Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: The primary efficacy endpoint is the number of patients with response in platelet count

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with drug-related adverse events
The secondary endpoint is the number of patients reaching the cut off point for ITP, which is defined as platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000 at any visit

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
